intro: Centaurium taganum, commonly known as Tagan mountain centaury, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at higher elevations. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, with five petals, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Centaurium taganum is often found in mountainous regions of countries such as Kazakhstan and Mongolia.
